item.title: To REM Perchance to Dream
item.description: “… At first Senseless as beasts I gave men sense, Possessed them of mind… In the beginning, seeing, they saw amiss, And hearing, heard not, but like phantoms huddled In dreams, the perplexed story of their days confounded…" Aeschylus, “Prometheus Bound” “Man permits himself to be deceived in his dreams every night of his life” Nietzsche “On Truth and Lies in the Extramoral sense” “A man dreamed… and when he awoke he went to his soothsayer and desired that his dream be made plain unto him.

item.title: Between Scylla and Charybdis: Neoliberalism in Algeria?
item.description: Exordium A Financial Times article1 from June 14, 2021 titled “Algeria on the brink as pandemic and low oil price take their toll” caught my eye the other day. As I read on, I was struck by a sense of uneasiness both at the implications of the article and at my ignorance regarding the history and trajectory of the country. And thus came the impetus for the text that follows.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Hello! My name is Rami. This website is intended to serve as a sort of brouillon and exposition of the various things I’m interested in. If you’d like to get a copy of my resume or get in contact with me for whatever reason, don’t hesitate to email me or connect with me (checkout the Contact Page)!
